subject: Art & Design
title: Line Length: The 45-75 Character Rule
description: A short lesson to help you apply Line Length: The 45-75 Character Rule.

hook.text: Reading a line of text that stretches across your entire widescreen monitor feels exhausting. Here's why.

buildup.text: The eye has to travel back to the start of the next line. Longer lines = harder to find your place.

discovery.text: The ideal line length is 45-75 characters per line. Books, newspapers, and good websites all follow this.

twist.text: On mobile, shorter is better: 30-40 characters. That's why responsive design adjusts column width.

climax.text: Set max-width on text containers. Never let paragraphs stretch to the full viewport width.

punchline.text: The best text doesn't fill the screen. It respects the eye.

quiz.question: What is the ideal line length for body text?
options: As wide as the screen allows
